greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = 7*binomial(n,k) for 1 <= k <= n with T(n,n) = 1 for n >= 0.
comment: Non-diagonal entries of Pascal's triangle are multiplied by 7. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 20 2007
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
example: Triangle T(n,k) (with rows n >= 0 and columns k = 0..n) begins:
maple: T := proc (n, k) if k < n then 7*binomial(n, k) elif k = n then 1 else 0 end if end proc; for n from 0 to 10 do seq(T(n, k), k = 0 .. n) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 20 2007
program: (MAGMA) [k eq n select 1 else 7*Binomial(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 18 2019
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 18 2019
Flat(List([0..10], n-> List([0..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 18 2019
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jun 15 2007
ext: Corrected and extended by _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 20 2007
